Shrimp & Linguine with Piccata Compound Butter Recipe | Bon Appetit




















































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginrecipesShrimp & Linguine with Piccata Compound Butter1 RatingFacebookPinterestTwitterEmail4 servingsThis incredibly easy recipe has everything you need for a perfect weeknight dinner. We're talking flavorful seafood and pasta with one of our favorite ingredients: butter!PrintIngredients1 lb. dried linguine1 stick salted butter, at room temperature3 Tbsp. fresh parsley leaves1 large lemon20 oz shrimp, peeled and deveined2 Tbsp. salted butter3 Tbsp. capers4 garlic cloves1/2 cup dry white wine1 tsp. crushed red pepper flakesRecipe PreparationZest and juice a large lemon. Roughly chop capers. Pull apart parsley leaves and roughly chop. Set aside.Combine 1 stick of salted butter and all other ingredients, besides the lemon juice, together in a medium bowl. Mash the mixture with the back of a wooden spoon. Add lemon juice 1 tsp at a time until just incorporated but not wet, about 1 Tbsp total. Then, cover with plastic wrap and chill.Add salt to large pot of water and bring to a boil. Cook linguine to al dente package directions. Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup of the pasta water.While the pasta cooks, season shrimp with salt and pepper.Chop 4 cloves of garlic.In a large Dutch oven, melt the 2 Tbsp of salted butter on medium-low heat. Add garlic and sauté until just fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the white wine, red pepper flakes, and several cracks of black pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook until wine is reduced by half, 2-3 minutes.Once the wine is reduced, add the shrimp in an even layer and cook, stirring occasionally, until just opaque, 2 to 3 minutes.Add the cooked linguine to the shrimp. Add the prepared piccata butter in evenly distributed dollops. Then, add ¼ cup of pasta water.Toss vigorously with tongs until creamy and emulsified, adding more pasta water a bit at a time if needed. Season with salt and pepper to taste.Divide between four plates.Garnish with the reserved parsley, freshly cracked pepper, and serve.Recipe by American Butter InstituteRelated VideoShrimp & Linguine with Piccata Compound ButterReviews SectionReviewsWrite a review…This was incredible! One of my most popular dishes (: we even replaced the shrimp with chicken for my boyfriend and he loved it! That compound butter and the lemony zing are fantastic.
